intro: Normania triphylla, commonly known as the three-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has trifoliate leaves, meaning each leaf is divided into three parts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in various horticultural settings.
